citation: Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and with the approval of each House of Parliament, by this my proclamation made under sections 16(1) and 14(1) of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 â€“

        (a) declare that the area of Crown land declared to be a scenic reserve and known as Henty Glacial Moraine Scenic Reserve in Statutory Rules 1970, No. 124, and deemed reserved land in the class of State reserve under section 53(1) of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 , ceases to be reserved land; and
        (b) declare the Crown land specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of State reserve; and
        (c) give the name Henty Glacial Erratics State Reserve to that reserved land; and
        (d) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
30 July 2001

W. J. E. COX

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Area of land

All that area of land comprising about 1.147 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5610 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 8 August 2001

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
